bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 17 (Thursday, January 28, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McCARTHY:H.R. 4395.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 of the Constitution statesthat Congress shall have power to regulate Commerce withforeign Nations, and among the several States, and with theIndian Tribes.[Page H375]

item.title: A bill to repeal the provision permitting the use of rocket engines from the Russian Federation for the evolved expendable launch vehicle program.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Strategic Forces.
Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text: This bill amends the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2016 to repeal, and deem never to have been enacted, the requirement that the Evolved Expendable Launch Vehicle service competitive procurements be open for award to all certified providers of such systems offering the best value to the government, regardless of the rocket engine's country of origin (including the Russian Federation), for the evolved expendable launch vehicle program.

bill.title: To repeal the provision permitting the use of rocket engines from the Russian Federation for the evolved expendable launch vehicle program.

item.title: To repeal the provision permitting the use of rocket engines from the Russian Federation for the evolved expendable launch vehicle program.
To repeal the provision permitting the use of rocket engines from the Russian Federation for the evolved expendable launch vehicle program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Strategic Forces.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
